title: Stored XSS in Public Profile Reviews

profile.name: Judge.me
profile.about: Judge.me powers the product reviews for e-commerce stores. Our apps help you collect and display reviews on Shopify, WooCommerce and BigCommerce.

vulnerability_information: Summary: Stored XSS found in public profile review in which we can add product details in shop addition options. In description of shop product we can add data URI XSS in HTML format which is led to XSS once user click on HTML. In data URI XSS payload is encrypted in base64 Steps To Reproduce: 1. Login with registered username and go to profile. 2. After that click on add recommendation and add product details and in it's description add below payload: Click Here { Data URI XSS: data:text/html;charset=utf-7;base64,PHNjcmlwdD5hbGVydCgiWFNTIik8L3NjcmlwdD4= (PHNjcmlwdD5hbGVydCgiWFNTIik8L3NjcmlwdD4=) : } 3. Now save the form by filling rest columns. 4. If any one views public profile and click on HTML tag, it will trigger XSS. Proof Of Concept: Video POC attached ## Impact Attacker can execute XSS in the victim user using judge platform

activities.message:
Hi @vj1naruto,

Thank you for your report!

Unfortunately, this was submitted previously by another researcher, but we appreciate your work and look forward to additional reports from you.

For transparency, we have invited you to the original report. Please do not comment on the original submission. If you have any further questions or concerns, please post it on this report instead.

Have a great day ahead! 

Best regards,
@turtle_shell

Hi Team,

Thanks for response.

In duplicate report reporter has showed impact of attacker can use this bug for phishing attack but in my report I have used bug to trigger XSS which has more impact.

Can I ask to revaluate the report with respect to impact?

Dear Team,

In duplicate report reporter has showed impact of attacker can use this bug for phishing attack but in my report I have used bug to trigger XSS which has more impact.

Can I ask to revaluate the report with respect to impact?

or I need to report this report once again freshly?

Hi @vj1naruto ,

Thank¬†you¬†for your submission. I hope¬†you¬†are well. We were not able to validate your report.

1) click on your `Click Here` link directly but didn't do anything (I didn't see any XSS alert on judge.me domain)
2) Open new link tab -> show XSS but it seems to run on a different domain, which doesn't seem to have any security impact on our judge.me domain.

Could you please help us demonstrate security impact on our judge.me domain?

Dear Team,

Thanks for response.

Yes data URI is executed in other domain but since it is initiated from the html code that any attacker can put in judge.me domain.
And attacker can run any malicious script in html code using data URI payloads in victim users system whoever visit the public profile and click on html executed code.

Xss is not triggering in judge.me domain but it is initiated from judge.me domain so it do not impact domain but it can impact users which will visit judge.me domain public profile.

Hi @vj1naruto 

We still don't understand how this can impact user or our domain but this behavior does look strange and suspicious which may affect our reputation so we would consider this as Low severity.
Thanks for the report, we will work on a fix for this.

Dear Team,

My suggested fix will be in html tag, allow 'href' or 'src' to be started by http or https only so that no data URI can be inserted in it.

And thanks for bounty.!!üòÅ
We have fixed this issue by disallowing `<a>` HTML tags altogether to be safe, and we will automatically create `<a>` tags for link-like texts instead. Can you please help us retest this?

I have repeated the steps for reproducing the the vulnerability and also used another multiple payloads of HTML but the vulnerability was not reproduce-able after the fix.
I have attached video POC of the retesting I have done to retest the vulnerability.
Thanks for the retest and for the videos!
